alert.note: Alert for Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 5:18PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Utah, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in normally dry washes, low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen across southeastern portions of Washington County, with up to 1.75 inches in some tributaries of the Fort Pearce Wash in Arizona, including Dutchman Draw. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Pearce Wash, St George, Washington, Hurricane and Sand Hollow State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
